hedline.hl1: World Business Briefing | Asia: Japan: Machine Orders Decline

abstract.p: Japan's machinery orders, which anticipate capital spending by about half year, fell 1.6 percent in September compared with those in August (S)

block.p: Defying expectations for an increase, orders in Japan for new machinery slid for a third straight month, a sign that an upturn in capital spending may be losing steam. Orders, which anticipate capital spending by about a half year, fell 1.6 percent in September compared with those in August. Corporate investment has been one driver of the economy and the slowdown in the third quarter suggests that the recovery is slowing.
